Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label different types of habitats, such as a playground, garden, forest, pond, or stream.
The student can illustrate various kinds of plants found in each habitat, like trees, grasses, bushes, and flowering plants.
The student can depict different animals or insects in each habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, ants, or fish.
The student can show comparisons by drawing the diversity of living things found in different habitats, highlighting how they are similar or different.
The student can include patterns observed in the natural world in their drawings, showcasing the variety and placement of plants and animals in each habitat.
